Homage to the Bodhisattva Ocean Thunder Sound of all dharmas. I take refuge in the immeasurable and boundless great bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas of the worlds of the ten directions, such as these.
I respectfully pay homage to the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and all the sages.

Homage to Ä€nanda, Homage to RÄhula, Homage to Cundaka, Homage to Piá¹‡á¸ola-BharadvÄja, Homage to KÄlodÄyin, Homage to Aniruddha, Homage to UpÄli, Homage to Revata, Homage to the Venerable MahÄkauá¹£á¹­hila I take refuge in the greatly renowned great arhats such as these.
Having paid homage to the Three Jewels, I will next repent.
Disciples!
Having already repented the retributions of the three evil paths, I will now further repent the remaining retributions of humans and gods.

We receive this lifespan in JambudvÄ«pa, although it is said to be a hundred years, few actually reach that. In the meantime, the number of premature deaths in one's prime is immeasurable. Only various sufferings torment the body and mind, and worries and fears are never absent for a moment.

This is all because the roots of goodness are weak and evil karma is abundant, causing the present mind to do things that are all unsatisfactory. One should know that this is all the remaining retribution of evil karma from the past.
Therefore, disciples!
Today, with utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Buddha.

Homage to the Buddha above the lotus in the east, homage to the Buddha King of Subjugation in the south, homage to the Buddha of Immeasurable Light in the west, homage to the Buddha of Supreme Faculties in the north, homage to the Buddha of Lotus Reverence in the southeast, homage to the Buddha of Immeasurable Flowers in the southwest, homage to the Buddha of Sovereignty and Wisdom in the northwest, homage to the Buddha of Red Lotus Virtue in the northeast, homage to the Buddha of Discrimination in the nadir, homage to the Buddha of Subjugated Enemies and Wisdom in the zenith. I take refuge in the Three Jewels throughout the ten directions and the entire Dharma realm.
Disciples!

From beginningless time until now, all present and future karmic retributions in the realms of humans and gods, past offenses and karmic bonds, hundreds of illnesses and afflictions, and incomplete six sense faculties - I repent of these offenses and retributions.
I repent of the retribution of offenses and retributions for being born in borderlands with wrong views, in the three evil realms, or in the eight difficult circumstances;
I repent of the retribution of offenses and retributions for having many illnesses, wasting away, and dying prematurely in the human realm;

The suffering of humans who cannot always keep and protect their six relatives and loved ones, we repent of this karmic retribution.ğŸ”½The suffering of humans who lose their loved ones and are separated from them, we repent of this karmic retribution.
The suffering of humans who gather with enemies and experience sorrow and fear, we repent of this karmic retribution.
The suffering of humans who are in danger from water, fire, thieves, robbers, and weapons, and experience fear and terror, we repent of this karmic retribution.

The suffering of humans who are alone, destitute, and homeless, and have lost their country, we repent of this karmic retribution.ğŸ”½The suffering of humans who are imprisoned, detained, and stand to one side, and are whipped and tortured, we repent of this karmic retribution.
The suffering of humans who have disputes in public and private matters, slander and defame each other, we repent of this karmic retribution.

The suffering of humans who suffer from chronic illnesses for years and months without getting better, and are unable to get up from their pillows and beds, we repent of this karmic retribution.ğŸ”½The suffering of humans who suffer from cold in winter and epidemics in summer, and from injuries and colds, we repent of this karmic retribution.
The suffering of humans who suffer from evil winds, swelling, and obstruction, we repent of this karmic retribution.
In the human realm, being sought after by evil spirits who wish to create misfortune and harm, repenting of the offenses and retributions;
In the human realm, birds crying out a hundred strange things, flying corpses and evil ghosts creating strange occurrences, repenting of the offenses and retributions;
In the human realm, being injured by tigers, leopards, wolves, jackals, and all kinds of evil birds and beasts on land and in water, repenting of the offenses and retributions;

In the human realm, binding oneself, piercing oneself, killing oneself, and harming oneself, repenting of the offenses and retributions;ğŸ”½In the human realm, worrying about oneself, lamenting oneself, restraining oneself, being angry with oneself, and being happy with oneself, repenting of the offenses and retributions;
In the human realm, throwing oneself into pits, burning oneself, drowning oneself, and falling to one's death, repenting of the offenses and retributions.
In the human realm, lacking authority, virtue, fame, and renown, repenting of the offenses and retributions;
In the human realm, not being able to obtain clothing and necessities to one's satisfaction, repenting of the offenses and retributions;
In the human realm, when going out and about, encountering evil friends who create obstacles, repenting of the offenses and retributions.
In this way, in the present and future, among humans and gods, repenting of the offenses and retributions of immeasurable misfortune, calamity, disaster, difficulty, and affliction.
Disciples!
Today, with utmost sincerity, I confess my faults before the Buddhas, the Venerable Dharma, and the Holy Sangha, revealing my heart and seeking their compassion.
May the disciples, by the merit generated from this repentance,
wish to be fully endowed with physical characteristics in every life, like RÄhula, and always encounter the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.
May we always hear the wonderful Dharma, have a lifespan equal to that of heaven and earth, and not be bound by a hundred illnesses. May our six
relatives and loved ones always be able to protect us, and may we forever be separated from enemies, thieves, and weapons. May our
clothes and boxes always be filled, and may our bowls always be filled with fragrant rice of a hundred flavors. May prisons and confinement
transform into heavenly paradises, and may slander and dispute transform into harmony. May long-term illnesses forever depart from our
bodies and minds, and may all calamities and disasters of epidemic poisons always leave our minds. May all ghosts, goblins, and flying birds,
tigers, leopards, wolves, and all calamities of water and land be completely removed without exception. May we either
Or to be angry or delighted oneself, such offenses I pray will be forever left behind from now on, until I attain
buddhahood.

I pray that disciples will not experience the retribution of the evil paths, but will only give rise to great compassion to save and protect all beings, causing them to exhaust their natures, widely transforming all kinds, and together ascending to perfect enlightenment.
The Sutra of the Monk Baodai's Questions and Answers on Retribution in the Lotus Flower of the Marvelous Dharma, Baodai previously entered the Rocket Hell.
Why is it called the Rocket Hell?

The prison is ninety yojanas long and wide, surrounded by iron walls with raging flames, the ground is covered with iron spikes, the smoke and fire burn the sinners, and from the four sides of the ground, gusts of wind rise together, in the empty space, violent winds suddenly blow and strike the iron mountains.

The mountain grinds them, turning them into rockets. The rockets rub against each other, fire and smoke blaze together. The body hair of the arrows also catches fire. They shoot the sinners, entering from the head and exiting from the soles of the feet, entering from the back and exiting from the chest, penetrating through the left and right. The wounds are on fire, with smoke and flames coming out together.

The sinners wail in pain, beyond words. They experience immeasurable suffering for a day and night, dying a thousand times and being reborn a thousand times, dying ten thousand times and being reborn ten thousand times.
Baota asked:
What sins did these monks commit to come and receive these retributions?
The horse-headed rakshasa replied:

These monks received the pure precepts of the Buddha but did not uphold them purely. They did not protect their dignified conduct like the Dharma of laypeople. They held bows and arrows in their hands, losing the dignified conduct of the Buddha.
As it is said in the sutra:
'In the past, there was a monk named Sali who did not protect his dignified conduct. He held a layperson's bow and arrow in his hand. For ten thousand generations, he received the evil retribution.'
For this reason, you should know that Å›ramaá¹‡as who do not guard their deportment will fall into the three evil destinies. This bhiká¹£u is also like this.
